text: The reports are clear. There's a new enemy.
A new unlimited source of shitty games has appeared, and we don't know who's behind all of this
Indeed, Potato-Masher. You're right
Hey! We're over here!
Fuck, I can't see shit with these glasses on! And it's pitch black! Cannot we...
Anyway...
I was saying that things won't be easy this time.
Look
So? What do you think?
M'yeah, that's not bad.
This one, it's me as a sailor.
I like it because I have a cap on.
I love it. Can we go back to the topic ?
Look at this instead
The evidence is clear. The machines are heading to Sion
They're digging. Machines entirely dedicated to one goal:
Our destruction!
We only have 48 hours left
How do you know?
I think it sounds good when they are ultimatums.
We'll never succeed! We're screwed!
Calm down, WinRar! Chill out! (pun on decompress)
It's easy to say! I've worked for you for 15 years and you never paid me!
We'll have to take the Chosen One to the source, so that he reprograms the original code in order to reformat the system
Or something like that...
What?
Alright, no time to waste. But I have a question first.
I'm listening to you Potato-Masher.
Who are all these guys?

Hello.
What ? Them?
Oh yeah. Those are the members of the club that usually occupy the room.
Hurry up and leave the room. There's another group after you !
A second group. Enemies approaching !
Emergency extraction! Everyone go back to their exit!
[squeaking leather]
[Joueur du Grenier's theme]
Hi everyone! We already talked about this console several times
But I realized that we never really took the time to present it
So I'll fix this unfairness by presenting you the GameCube
Yes, it's a HE. It's a boy
Look
Released in 2002, around two years after the release of the PS2
The GameCube announced Nintendo's resurgence
It was the first console of the Japanese firm to finally replace the cartridges with disks
Unfortunately, facing the crushing of the PS2, the competition was challenging
And the Nintendo console, like the N64, could only rely on its famous titles
Zelda Wind Waker, Mario Sunshine or Super Smash Bros just to name these three
The console wasn't a commercial failure either
But it barely managed to compete against the Xbox, ending 3rd in total sales
FYI, after the GameCube, many people thought that Nintendo was about to die
SEGA just signed its death warrant as a console developer with the DreamCast
And Nintendo did a series of half-failures with the N64 and the GameCube
People already saw Xbox and Sony as the only console developers on the market
But the experience of this half-failure finally gave Nintendo the opportunity to come back with the worldwide hit that is...
The Wii
It's a girl
She turns 13 this year
So this joke is gross
We already talked about games on this console; Aquaman, Batman Dark Tomorrow, Catwoman, Charlie's Angels
But there's a game that I regularly see in lists of the worst games of the sixth console generation
It's Bad Boys 2, released in 2004
So, from what I've seen, the story seems to be in parallel with the movie plot
I mean, I think...
I mean, I didn't check, I already struggle to play this shit, I won't watch Bad Boys 2 a second time on top of that. Cut the crap!
The game starts as a young lady stops by a diner to buy food for her colleague
But while she's ordering her food, a bomb explodes, killing her partner
But there's no one in the car!
Don't say anything. Enjoy the drama and acting quality
[BEST DRAMATIC SCENE]
Anyway, the game looks like a classic third person shooter
But...a thing that stands out
Look out, prepare to be blown away because it's the only original thing of the game
This game contains a morality system, and you can either become a good cop or a "bad boy"
Like, the more people you kill, the more bad boy you'll become
We can applaude their attempt to put a morality system in a game where you kill people without asking them to surrender first
On the contrary, to become a good cop, you have to disarm your enemies by shooting their weapon
Except that it's way too annoying to do that!
I mean, you need to aim precisely at the pixel of their weapon
When you're far, you can barely make out where it is, and when there's like 50 enemies in front of you, how are you supposed to do this?
Let me recall that we're on console
I play with a controller. Good luck to aim properly!
[gunshots]
"Fuck! Stop!"
I won't even talk about times when you can just disarm your enemies...
With a shotgun!
"Lesson n°1 to be a good cop. In order to disarm an enemy: always aim at the weapon"
[explosion]
"There"
"The enemy is disarmed"
At the end of each level, your boss summarizes your shots, targets shot, areas you aimed etc.
For example, here I killed 47 people and disarmed 8
That's fine. 1 out of 7. That's not bad
The game is also nice to you. For example, here you can see that I did ONLY 5 executions
In other words, 5 people, who surrendered, got on their knees, but whom I still shot in the head
And my boss is happy! Look!
[kids cheering]
"5 people killed"
"That's not so bad!"
Also note that your "bad boy meter" will increase if you do enough material damage
And, by the way, it will increase way faster
So, killing a guy is okay, but break a plank...WHAT?!
Anyway, quickly about the game plot...Why are we wandering in arcades and killing everybody in the first level ?
Because we were supposed to rescue the cop girl, but it's done by the first three minutes of the level
And after that, the game continues and we go around the block, killing people, I don't know why
They must have thought: "while we're here..."
"You've had enough...you've had enough of these thugs!"
Of course, the artificial intelligence is the usual diarrhea
The enemies run around randomly like teens dressed as unicorns at ComicCon
They stay in front of you like traffic cones waiting to be killed
And when the A.I miraculously manages to find a cover
[game show failure music]
And of course, don't forget the cherry on top with the camera that freaks out everytime you're in a hallway
Not bad. That camera angle...that's not bad to aim at enemies in the room, I like it
You can do better, I think. Can we...Ah!
Good!
GOOD!
By the way, I need to talk about the cover system of this game because I really need to
Actually, the game gives you only some places to hide, indicated by the circles on the ground
So you always end up in ridiculous situations, I mean look here...
The game wants me to take cover here
But if I'm here and I stand up to shoot, I'm behind the crates and can't see the enemies! Fuck!
I don't want to judge this game hastily, but to me, this game is like the shit that's stuck in your toilet bowl, that is
It's here, it doesn't really stink anymore since it's been there for so long
But it's not the kind of thing you want to show to your guests. And you kind of want to piss on it
Yeah, I criticize a bit, there
We played quite far in this game, and each level is as fun as a copy machine party
It's always the same; never-ending levels. And considering the enemies' intelligence
The only way they managed to put difficulty in this game was to put waves of mentally handicapped killing themselves by standing there
Knowing that the other challenge are levels where you protect your partner from their own stupidity
"No, Billy. Don't hide behind the canon. That doesn't help me!"
"No, Billy. Taking cover doesn't mean staying in the middle of the fucking open!"
By the way, after ten minutes of playing this...
You would sell your SOUL, so they would shut the fuck up!
In Bad Boys 2: the movie, the dialogues were lowbrow, but here, both of your characters spend the entire levels
Sending each other old rusty punchlines every 4 seconds
That would pose Amy Schumer's shows as a Shakespearean comedy
"Hey! I got my asshole burst by Russians!"
"That's really nuts!"
"But you don't have nuts, though!"

[Actual line in the game]
*that's not the literal translation, so the in-game line is probably different*
Anyway, I don't know if this game deserves to be among the worst existing games
I think the people who did these lists never played Dragon's Lair
But in any case, it deserves a place in the garbage can
Waffle Iron, have you made progress?
It can't be...
Waffle Iron, answer me!
I don't know! It's frozen on a fucking screen saver!
Grenier, we must go see the Oracle
She's the only one who can help you avenge your dog's death and prevent the bus from exploding if it goes over 50 miles per hour
Your're right...anyway...
...This plot makes no sense
However, Grenier...
There's something you need to know about the Oracle
I can show you the door, Chosen One. But the choice of passing it is only yours
Finally, you talk! You haven't said anything in 30 minutes!
Why can't you come with me, by the way?
Actually, she's got a restraining order
We had a disagrement
Welcome, Chosen One. She's waiting for you
Well, you're right on time, Chosen One
And quite handsome!
Who are you?
And not too bright
Yeah, chill out
I'd ask you to sit down, but
You prefer to stand up
And I only have one chair, anyway
By the way, don't worry about the vase
What vase?
I...I'm really sorry
I said don't worry about it
You came here for some advice
You're looking for your role in this whole story
And you're probably wondering about the rest of the video
And don't worry about the aquarium
What aquarium?
Oh fuck! I'm so sorry!
Yeah, that's okay. But be careful, please!
The truth is, to move forward, and to find the next game, you'll have to...
Find yourself first
Look up
What does it mean?
I don't know. Got it for 3 bucks at CostCo
And don't worry about this
Giant clock. Where did you get that?!
Incredible. You can really predict the future
How many fingers am I hiding behind my back?
Listen, I'll make it quick
Take this game and go. It contains your answers
Alright. And thanks to it, will I be able to find the source of the Matrix code?
I had two fingers
Yeah, that's it! Go now!
So, I don't have to find myself anymore?
No, it's okay. Nobody cares. Get lost!
Thank you, Oracle. I knew I could count on you
The Matrix saga, one of the most famous franchises of the 2000s!
Almost every scene of this film is cult, the bullet time scene was parodied billions of times
I think these movies, or at least the first one marks the gap between light-tone 90s action movies
And the darker movies of post 2000s
The sequel , Matrix Reloaded releases in 2003, followed a few months later by Matrix Revolution, the third opus
Many small features were added to the franchise, like the Animatrix, animated movies that I highly recommend
And two days before the second movie hit the theaters, we were granted a video game
That was supposed to take place in parallel with the movie, and more or less link the second and third movie
It's Enter the Matrix, which is, prepare yourself, the video game based on a movie that sold the most in whole History!
So that must be an excellent game!
The game follows two characters; Nyobe and Ghost, characters who appear in the second movie
But let's be clear, if you haven't watched the movies, the game immediately leaves you behind like a puppy on the side of the road during summer
So I'm going to assume that everybody watched them, and if it's not the case, then go watch them
This game is quite the classic third person shooter where...
Okay, um. Before I talk about the game, just a word on the running animation
I know that in Matrix, everybody runs like this
But it works in the movies because they are chased!
But in Enter the Matrix, 70% of the time, you're in perfectly safe, empty hallways
I know, people will say: "JDG, hypocrisy, complains about anything"
But it would be stupid if an RPG character would go to the bakery like this:
And again, I'm nice. I'm just talking about the running animation, I won't talk about the rest
So, for the controls; there's two buttons for hand-to-hand combat, a move to disarm enemies
A button to shoot and another to jump
And of course, there's a concentration bar that triggers the bullet time and slows up time
And it gives you the possibility to perform "Matrixian" actions while fighting
Fights that alternate between the real Matrix, with well choregraphed moves, which is great to look at
But which regularly ends up in brawls between two drunk gypsies, with characters getting or blocking non-existent hits as if they were in a low budget Hong Kong flick
And by the way, fighting would be a bit better if they weren't filmed by a Pastis drunk cameraman that would do anything to piss you off
But in the end, the main problem with this game is that spinning around, the bullet time and all that shit
Is kind of useless
You need to understand that in Enter the Matrix, the lock, or targeting of the enemies, is automatic
And by the way it's so automatic that bullets can go in a direction completely opposite from where your weapon is aiming
So no real need to aim, there
"Come on, Grenier! You know that the Matrix allows us to alter reality and to..."
"I've never seen anyone move that fast"
Actually, your character automatically locks on enemies, loosely based on where you point with the camera
And in this game, enemies are guards, agents, cops...
It's 99% of enemies who shoot from a distance, and who often shoot from far away
When you start to play, it's funny because you jump around, and it's Matrix so that's why we're here for, after all
But after a few hours of playing, when the difficulty and the amount of enemies start to increase, all the fights start to look like this:
[heroic music]
[gunshots]
[the price is right fail horn]
And in the end, it's way more practical and easier to stay hidden behind a crate like a piece of shit and kill people from afar
Especially since the game gives you a lot of elements subtly put where you need it
"Hey! Anyone knows why we store explosive barrels in the middle of the runway?!"
"Shut up and hide behind it!"
By the way, you've seen it for a bit now...
I think that concerning the gameplay, there's no real need to detail each level one by one
In fact, the first level gives you exactly the tone of almost all of the game
Which is: hallway, fight, hallway, fight, hallway, fight
With some variation from time to time with car chase missions
"Surrender or we'll open fire!"
[gunshots]
"Lesson n°2 to be a good cop: always ask the enemy to surrender after shooting them"
"Wait"
The missions with the car are clearly the worst part of the game because it's SO ANNOYING!
These missions last way too long and the car is absolutely out of control!
That's insane! What's the problem?! Are the wheels square or what ?!
That's great! I've nothing to add, now the game makes the jokes for me!
That's perfect, because now's the time to talk about the graphics
In this game, it goes back and forth, it goes from just decent
To absolutely horrid, with levels here you can clearly tell the designers didn't want to go to work that day
"Come travel in our brand new First Class:"
"A single seat on the floor"
"Ethiopian Airlines: yes, it exists"
Luckily, the game developpers found a solution to overcome the mediocre graphics
"You know, the graphics aren't ugly if you can't see them!"
Which leads to entire levels like these
Indeed, they're right
It's not ugly
I approve
That being said, I'll still use the passwords to see the rest because...
I have no excuse, I just didn't want to
[PASSWORD MENU]
That's DOS
This
Is DOS!
Some day, somewhere, someone in this world thought:
"DOS is funny, I'll put it in a video game!"
This guy must live a horrible life!
For kids watching, DOS is basically what existed before Windows
Commands to type in order to access folders and subfolders etc.
It's boring, long and tideous and it generally ends with these two magic words:
Okay, so, read on my lips
"DOS IS NOT FUN!"
Also, I'm doing DOS on a console!
With a controller!
It's the worst of both worlds!
I can't even find where to enter this fucking password!
I can joke for a bit, it's the Matrix, that's funny and all
But if I enter a password menu in a video game
I would prefer typing my password in less than 40 minutes!
Goddammit!
WELL! I SEE THAT WE HAVE A RIVAL TO DRAGON'S LAIR BALLS! CONGRATULATIONS!
By the way, I haven't even talked about the plot yet, so I'll do it
Because this game might as well be named "Enter the Matrix: 5 minutes after Neo"
Because the entirety of the game consists in arriving 5 minutes after Neo and be like:
"Oh shoot! We missed him again!"
Actually, the game contains a lot of unseen cutscenes with the actors that were shot while filming the two sequels, just to make the most of the sets
But my theory is that, because the actors wouldn't bother to learn new dialogues just for the game
They thought that they would just reshot the same scenes
There!
So the key scenes of the game are the same as in the movie
Neo meets the Oracle, your character meets the Oracle
Neo makes out with Persephone, your character does the same
And wether it's the camera angles or the dialogues, it's exactly like the movie
Even the scene where Neo messes up his kiss a first time and does it again, is the same in the game!
Later on, Neo meets the Keykeeper and fights him
You arrive 5 minutes later and do the same exact thing!
Wait, so that means that the Asian guy beat Neo, Ghost and Nyobe all in the same day?
I think you need to handle your anger, Sir!
I don't say that to complain either. I mean it's cool, it's Matrix
But I mean...it's really lazy!
And let me ask this: if we do everything that Neo does,
Then why don't we just play as Neo?
This problem led to the development of the next game called: The Path of Neo
Where you replay the movie, but as Neo
A game that is quite accurate to the movie and its key scenes, and doesn't really deraves form its path
[A FEW MINUTES LATER]
[OR NOT]
Please note that I said "quite accurate"
It works in court!
Alright, I found a path. Pass this door and you'll immediately find the source code!
Copy that Waffle Iron, I'm on my way!
Hello Grenier
You know who I am

Seb?
No.
Yes!

No!
Yes!

No
YES!
Its not important
I chose this appearance among others, but I can take the shape of anything
Look
Who are you?
I'm doing research on this guy. Apparently the game Enter the Matrix was created by a company called Atari but...
Atari is just a disguise. Before that, this company bore another name
And this name was...
And if I take this cat, for example
And if I start to talk with this Italian accent
Do you recognize me, Mr. Grenier?
Oh my God
Infogrames
Yes, we are everywhere. We're planning on taking over politics soon
Why am I here?
You're here because the Matrix forced you to make a consequent choice, in the form of an illusionary free will
Even though, you are a slave of causality
Inherent to your species
[What?]
That's...that's the end of the video
Oh! Okay
You are here to end the cycle that started ten years ago; put an end to this war
There are two doors. The one on the left puts an end to this story. All over with Infograms games
You've seen them all
All of this will disappear, and I'll disappear with it
While the door on the right will lead you directly to...
The bathroom!
[LEFT DOOR] [RIGHT DOOR]
You can't put annotations on Youtube anymore
Ah fuck!
It's time to make your choice
But we both know what you will choose, don't we?
Okay. And if I go back by the door I came from, what happens?
Uh, no! The Matrix doesn't allow us to...
And he's gone!
He's gone, so...
So that means that the war between the Joueur du Grenier and shitty games has just be...
Excuse me, can I use your bathroom, after all?
Fuck!
[Don't forget to subscribe to this channel and the bazar channel, so you never miss our next videos]
